ai.summary: Crowan FP 116 is a short, easy 1.4 km footpath walk in the United Kingdom. It’s suitable for most ages and fitness levels, offering a gentle countryside experience without demanding terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Typically a compact earth path with occasional grass sections. Mostly flat with light undulations; gates or stiles may appear along the route. Expect occasional muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on the designated footpath and respect private land boundaries. Wear sturdy footwear and bring water; check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Be mindful of uneven surfaces, gates or stiles, and livestock if present. In poor visibility or wet conditions, take extra care and consider shortening the route. Mobile signal can be limited in rural areas.
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the best conditions typically in spring and summer. Autumn can be pleasant, while winter visits may be muddy and daylight hours shorter.

seo.title: Crowan FP 116 – Easy 1.4 km UK Footpath Walk
seo.meta_description: Explore Crowan FP 116, an easy 1.4 km walk in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for this simple hike.
